verb.description: Stare in an angry or fierce way.
examples: she glared at him, her cheeks flushing

verb.description: (of the sun or an electric light) shine with a strong or dazzling light.
examples: the sun glared out of a clear blue sky
Murray narrowed his eyes against the glare of the sun

noun.description: Dazzling or showy appearance; tawdry brilliance.
examples: the pomp and glare of rhetoric

origin: Middle English (in the sense shine strongly): from Middle Dutch and Middle Low German glaren to gleam, glare: perhaps related to glass. The sense stare occurred first in the adjective glaring ( late Middle English).
